update.description:
This requires a few pull requests:

1. #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/141
2. #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/315

Easiest way to test this:

1. Inside the `ign-launch` examples folder:

```
ign launch gazebo_plugins.ign -v 4
```

2. Echo an odometry topic:

```
ign topic -et /model/vehicle_blue/odometry
```

3. Joystick the robots. Driving them in a circle should cause odometry to return back to zero.
update.title: Update and publish odometry

content.raw: There is an example [here](http://wiki.ros.org/navigation/Tutorials/RobotSetup/Odom) that uses just `linkname`.
content.html: There is an example here that uses just linkname.

content.raw: I thought it was just `linkname` since ROS is not designed to handle multiple models.
content.html: I thought it was just linkname since ROS is not designed to handle multiple models.

content.raw: Does the bridge expect the link frame to be `linkname` or `modelname/linkname`? Otherwise it's impossible to tell apart links from different models
content.html: Does the bridge expect the link frame to be linkname or modelname/linkname? Otherwise it's impossible to tell apart links from different models

content.raw:
Here it is: 58333bd.

![odom.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3381228954-odom.png)
content.html: Here it is: 58333bd.

content.raw: Cool. This is good to me once that's added. I added a demo using RViz to the bridge PR, it has a screenshot for proof, this works!
content.html: Cool. This is good to me once that's added. I added a demo using RViz to the bridge PR, it has a screenshot for proof, this works!

content.raw:
Thanks.

I have the ros1 update in place, just need to stop typing mercurial commands.
content.html:
Thanks.

I have the ros1 update in place, just need to stop typing mercurial commands.

content.raw:
The bridge will need to be updated to send `child_frame_id`, that's a [field](http://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/nav_msgs/html/msg/Odometry.html) on the ROS msg

You can use something like `ecm.ChildrenByComponents(modelEntity, components::CaninicalLink())`
content.html:
The bridge will need to be updated to send child_frame_id, that's a field on the ROS msg

You can use something like ecm.ChildrenByComponents(modelEntity, components::CaninicalLink())

content.raw: This is relevant only for velocity information.
content.html: This is relevant only for velocity information.

content.raw:
I need to add "child_frame_id" as well. 
Is there an easy way to get a model's canonical (first) link?
content.html: I need to add "child_frame_id" as well. Is there an easy way to get a model's canonical (first) link?

content.raw: We could do that, but that wouldn't capture wheel slip or the extreme case where a robot falls while the wheels keep spinning.
content.html: We could do that, but that wouldn't capture wheel slip or the extreme case where a robot falls while the wheels keep spinning.

content.raw: I guess one factor that makes this approach more realistic is that wheel slip influences the output.
content.html: I guess one factor that makes this approach more realistic is that wheel slip influences the output.

content.raw: LGTM. I added some notes to demos on 75340f6.
content.html: LGTM. I added some notes to demos on 75340f6.

content.raw: Another factor is wheel slip. This is especially noticeable on the track drive  demo.
content.html: Another factor is wheel slip. This is especially noticeable on the track drive demo.
75340f6

content.raw: Just curious, why are we going through the trouble of calculating odometry from wheel encoders when we could just publish ground truth pose and twist?
